primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human subject must invest moral effort (sowing) into the spiritual realm to ensure a future harvest of life and avoid the mechanical penalty of corruption.

tekstueel_bewijs: whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap
If that person chooses to jump...
we start off as fine gold and end up as so much mud

object.identificatie: Life Everlasting / Successful Harvest / Moral Stability
tekstueel_bewijs: shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting
only what you do for God will last

zender.identificatie: The Impersonal Law / The Moral Universe
tekstueel_bewijs: It is written into the structure of things
not even God can save us from the consequence of God's law
we shall reap, if we faint not
the flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily the hearer's own lack of stamina or 'chilled' devotion.

secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon conflates ethics and soteriology into a single program of 'investment'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Moral Law → Life Everlasting → The Sower

voorbeelden_god_subject: the God who put the physical world under the governance
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we act as if we are on our own
we must believe in the law

voorbeelden: we must believe in the law
Toil on, serve on, pray on, plant on
Paul tells us... what we have forgotten

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes the hearer has the inherent power (Pouvoir) but lacks the obligation (Devoir) or motivation (Vouloir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through human persistence in 'well-doing'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a mechanical consequence of law rather than a state from which one needs rescue.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon treats grace as a predictable law of nature. The 'engine' of the story is human effort; God is the guarantor of the system rather than the Savior of the person.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: God as bystander to His own laws
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: not even God can save us from the consequence of God's law
The law of kingdom investment is not, therefore, complicated.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Mention of Jesus as source of joy
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: we taste the joys of the Lord

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The child in the story is a direct model for the hearer's life journey.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ is the Sower who sowed his life into the earth to produce a harvest for us.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is a wage for 'well-doing' rather than a gift.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent as a moral philosophy, but theologically clashing with the concept of 'unmerited favor'.
spanning_punten: The claim that God cannot save someone from the law contradicts the nature of the Atonement.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: we are not so much punished for our sins as we are punished by our sins

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'soil' or the 'helper' but not the Subject who regenerates.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a bad investment with poor returns.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Law' sermon without 'Gospel'. The Subject is consistently 'We' and the Object is a 'Harvest' earned by 'Sowing'.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of every salvific verb.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Sower of Galatians 6.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We must sow', use 'Christ sowed himself into our death so that we might reap his life'.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Carefree youngster' who must work.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer as the 'bare and naked earth' that cannot grow anything until God plants the seed.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Spirit gives the power to do what the Law demands.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Present Sin as a power that prevents us from sowing anything good.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a heavy opponent, the need for a Savior is eclipsed by the need for a coach.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (Sowing) is treated as the cause of Soteriology (Reaping).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God reaps us in Christ) → Ethics (We sow in gratitude).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful but structurally deistic. It replaces the Gospel of Grace with a 'Law of Investment' that leaves the hearer alone with their own stamina.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is excellent (metaphors of gravity/asparagus); semiotically, it is a closed system of works-righteousness.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Galatians usually highlights the contrast between Law and Promise, which this sermon collapses.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'God' is actually a 'Helper' actant here, subordinate to the 'Subject' (Man) and the 'Sender' (The Law).

appendices.notities: The sermon utilizes a 'Natural Law' framework to explain spiritual realities, which inadvertently removes the necessity of divine intervention.
